intro: Hieracium parishii, commonly known as the Parish's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Hieracium parishii is often found in areas with well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
